byline.contributor: K.K. Rebecca Lai contributed reporting from New York.
byline.original: By ANDREW KEH and KEVIN QUEALY

abstract: At least 44 of 172 table tennis players at 2016 Olympics are Chinese-born, and six of them are representing China.
lead_paragraph: In the last few decades, a migration of table tennis players from China has produced a full-fledged diaspora of athletes on six continents, reshaping the landscape of the sport.
snippet: In the last few decades, a migration of table tennis players from China has produced a full-fledged diaspora of athletes on six continents, reshaping the landscape of the sport....

headline.main: At Least 44 Table Tennis Players in Rio Are Chinese-Born. Six Play for China.
headline.print_headline: No. 1 Foe for China: A Diaspora of Its Own
